loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married and has four children. She runs a grocery store to support her family. Luvuno owns a house without electricity or running water. 

Luvuno is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to expand her business and buy bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, spices, cabbages, and other fruits to meet the needs of her customers. She will go ahead with her life.

loans.use: buy bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, spices, and cabbages

loans.name: Medza

texts.en: Medza is requesting another 15,000 KES Kiva loan to pay school fees to educate her children and improve their future. She is grateful to Yehu and Kiva lenders for the opportunity to improve herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Ulziimaa

texts.en: Mrs. Ulziimaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her husband used to transport goods between cities with his own automobile but in January this year he began working as a driver at a university. Mrs Uliziimaa herself has been selling trousers at a trade center since 2009 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. She brings her goods from the Chinese border city of Ereen. During this time of year, demand for trousers reaches its peak so she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase trousers in large quantity from China. As a result, she will be able to continue to run her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. Mrs Uliziimaa is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of trousers

loans.name: Sofio

texts.en:
Sofio is 24 years old. She lives in the Kobuleti District with her 35-year-old husband, Mamuka, and her 16-year-old stepdaughter. The family's income comes from trading flowers. Sofio buys wholesale flowers and resells them with a price markup at the local market to earn a small monthly income. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up without any success. Sofio's loan request is rejected all the time due to her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Sofio is requesting a loan from Credo to build a greenhouse and start a family business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo that envisions the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. Sofio will use her loan to purchase building materials and flower seeds. She will grow her own flowers to sell. As she will not have to buy flowers from wholesalers, her profit will significantly grow. Sofio will use part of her profit to reinvest in her business and will also save for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and purchase flower seeds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a hardworking mother who has built her family out of the previous Kiva loan and also her business has grown well. She is requesting another loan of 10,000 KES to buy sacks of onions, tomatoes, potatoes, bananas and spices to enable her to meet the requirements of her clients and have enough supply for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions, tomatoes, potatoes, bananas and spices

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has three children, one of whom still attends school. She works buying, packaging, and selling hardwood charcoal. At first, Mary bought already-packaged charcoal, but she has been able to expand her storage area and now she can store up to 15,000 kilograms of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane to package the charcoal that she sells to small businesses. Mary sells charcoal from a small cart. 

Mary is requesting a loan to buy charcoal. Her customer base is increasing and she needs more charcoal to meet demand. In the future, Mary hopes to provide an education for her child who is attending school to help guarantee a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has 3 children, one of whom is school-age. She is from Kisauni, and she tells us that she has a business selling fruits and vegetables in Kongowea market on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays. She also sells in the Kisauni area the other days of the week. Her sales have been rising over time as she always has very good products and this business provides her with a good income. Now she is a successful small businesswoman with a sizable and loyal customer base, and this has helped her to support her family and her business.

She requests the help of Yehu Microfinance in order to buy fruits and vegetables that are currently in season, so that she can stock up her business and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru: Владимир имеет свой бизнес. Он продает мужскую молодежную одежду. Работает на центральном рынке, где он арендует киоск. Недавно Владимир поменял место на рынке -  снял более дорогой кисок, который находится на проходе. Теперь у Владимира больше покупателей. Владимир просит предостаить ему кредит 8,000 гривен для закупки весеннего товара. Он надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и заработать больше денег для своей семьи. Владимир живет с женой, сыном и мамой в своем доме.
texts.en: Vladimir is married with one son. His mother lives with him and his family in their home. He has his own business selling clothing for young men at the central market where he rents a kiosk. He recently changed his location at the market, renting a larger kiosk located near the aisle. As a result, he now has more customers. Vladimir is seeking a loan of 8,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya to buy spring clothing. He hopes to get additional profit and earn more money for his family.

loans.use: to buy spring clothing

loans.name: Anugrah Jaya Group

texts.en:
Lia is a mother of five children, all of them are still attending school. Lia has a business making "rengginang". Rengginang is a kind of Indonesian thick rice cracker, made from cooked glutinous sticky rice and seasoned with spices, made into a flat and rounded shape, and then sun-dried. The sun-dried rengginang is deep fried with ample cooking oil to produce a crispy rice cracker. Lia sells it around her environment and she also sells it in her child’s school. She can sell 7- 10 packs every day. One pack is priced at 10,000 IDR. 

Lia will use the profits for savings and buying school books. The rainy season is her obstacle to run this business. Eid al-Fitr is the best condition to sell her goods. Lia will use this loan to buy the ingredients and the wrap of her food. She hopes someday she can bring her child on vacation and have a food stand.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice, oil and plastic wrap

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a married mother of nine children, all grown up, has three years’ experience running a fruit and vegetable store in the market of Kisauni. A hardworking person, keen to overcome any difficulties, she starts work very early everyday since she has to find fresh produce for her store.

Agnes wants to expand her business and so is seeking a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, and potatoes to stock in her store and to respond to her customers’ requests. One of her goals is to have a spacious store where she can display all of her produce.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, and potatoes.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema, a married mother of two, lives in Kisauni where she owns a small store in the village. She has her own house that she was able to buy with a lot of effort. Working everyday to support her family, Neema tells us that she struggles daily to give her children the best. Through her business she hopes to give them the opportunity for dignified and decent lives.

Neema is requesting this loan to buy more products to sell such as flour, noodles, dairy items, bread, herbs, rice, etc. She has little money, but with her perseverance and daily work, she has been able to support her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as flour, noodles, dairy items, bread, herbs, rice, etc.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru:
Санавбар опытная учительница. Она преподаёт в школе своего городка. Она имеет троих детей, но как говорит сама Санавбар:"У меня не три, а десятки детей". Санавбар любит своих учеников как своих. У Санавбар двадцатипятилетний стаж работы учителя. Раньше её дохода хватало, но последние годы появилось нужда в дополнительных средствах,дети растут и расходов очень много. Санавбар решила параллельно со своей работой заняться скотоводством.
 Санавбар необходимо накопить деньги на учебу своих детей,она мечтает обучить их в высших учебных заведениях. Пользуясь сезонностью, и благоприятным моментом хочет закупить корм для скота и дополнительно КРС. Очень надеется на помощь и содействие со стороны МДО "Арванд" и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Sanobar is an experienced teacher, having been in this profession for 25 years.  She teaches in her town school.  Sanobar has three children, but as she herself says, "I have dozens of children, not just three."  Sanobar loves her students like her own children.  Her income from teaching used to be enough, but in the last few years, the need for additional income has arisen.  Her children are growing up and there are many expenses.  Because of this, Sanobar decided to go into the animal husbandry business in addition to her work as a teacher.  

Sanobar needs to save up money for her children's education.  Her dream is for them to have higher educations.  With the seasonal fluctuations in prices, now is an advantageous time to buy up cattle feed and additional cattle.  She is relying on MDO Arvand's help and assistance, and she thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta de 56 años de edad, es una campesina, radicada en la vereda las Pavas, del municipio del Santuario, Colombia, en donde reside en una finca con su esposo realizando las labores de mayordomos, desde hace más de veinte años. 
Su principal motivación para salir adelante son sus nietos, debido a que su hija falleció hace un año y debió asumir la responsabilidad de su crianza. Con el fin de garantizarles un mejor futuro, Berta se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera, ya que el propietario de la finca les prestó un lote. Espera que con esta inversión pueda iniciar con la producción de leche y mejorar la condición económica de su familia y garantizarles a sus tres nietos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Berta is a 56 year old farmer who lives in the area of Las Pavas, in the municipality of Santuario, Colombia, where she and her husband live on a small plot of land and have worked as house stewards for more than 20 years.

Her primary motivation for getting ahead in life is her grandchildren, as her daughter died a year ago and she has assumed responsibility for raising her children. In order to guarantee them a better future, Berta is applying for a loan so she may purchase a dairy cow as the property owner has loaned them a plot of land. She hopes that she can begin producing milk with this investment and improve the economic condition of her household and guarantee a strong education for her three grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 39 years old and lives in Guripuli, a village in the Khobi district of Georgia, with his 28-year-old wife Tamila and infant child Giorgi (one year old). He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Avtandil previously worked in Russia installing air conditioners and central heating systems. Now he is back in Georgia, he wants to start the same business there. Thus, he has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with favorable terms for the country rural poor, who do not have access to credit as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their income. 

With the received credit, Avtandil will purchase an electrical gimlet and other needed equipment for fitting central heating and air conditioner systems. He is very experienced in this field and is well known among his fellow villagers. This will increase his number of clients and help him to earn good profits. Part of the profit will be used to buy more equipment for further developing his business and another part will be used to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to install air conditioners and central heating

loans.name: Haidr

texts.en:
Haidr, 24 years old, is a married man who lives with his family in a poor area in Sana`a, Yemen. He has only a daughter, and he strives to offer her a good life. 

Haidr has been operating a cosmetic materials and perfume store. He mortgaged his wife’s gold to sell vegetables and fruits in the street. When he acquired much experience, he expanded his business to open a cosmetic materials and perfume store. 

Due to the bad situation which he faced, Haidr couldn’t stock his business to permit him to have a large clientele and guaranteed good sales. Because of this, he is currently asking for a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to buy cosmetic materials and perfumes. He wants to offer a better variety to his customers and thus increase his sales. He hopes that in this way his business will continually capitalize itself and his earnings will increase. 

Haidr hopes that, with more income, his family can enjoy a better quality of life and have better economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials and perfumes for expanding his business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза  женщина пастух.  Она отлично умеет разводить крупно рогатый скот и мелко рогатый  скот.  Так как в семье не было сыновей, Фируза с детства помогала отцу в скотоводстве. Теперь приобретённые навыки и занятия отца стали источником дохода Фирузы. Также она занимается дехканским хозяйством, от которого получает овощи, зелень и фрукты для ежедневного питания семьи. Вот уже тридцать лет она приносит "хлеб" в семью занятием скотоводство. В связи с временными трудностями связанное с финансами,Фируза решила обратиться за кредитом в МДО "Арванд" надеясь на свой будущий доход и благополучие. 
На приобретенный кредит хочет купить   крупно рогатый скот.   Заранее благодарит МДО "Арванд"  за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Firuza is a shepherd.  She is very knowledgeable in raising large and small cattle.  From her early childhood, she helped her father raise cattle because there were no sons in the family.  Now, the lessons and habits she learned from her father are Firuza's source of income.  For 30 years now, she has been "bringing home the bread" from her work in animal husbandry.  She also works as a farm laborer, from which she gets vegetables, greenery, and fruit for her family's regular diet.  

Because of some temporary financial difficulties, Firuza decided to apply to MDO Arvand for a loan, trusting in her future income and prosperity.  Firuza wants to use the loan to buy cattle.  She is grateful in advance to MDO Arvand for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kisauni. She is married and has two adult children. She has a small store in Kisauni where sales are ever on the rise which generates a good amount of income for her.

She tells us that, with the help of her husband and her whole family, the family is getting ahead due to a lot of sacrifice and hard work. They try to help each other out, like families do, so that, through their work, they can continue to get ahead and achieve a better lifestyle.

She is currently a successful, small businesswoman with a large, loyal clientele thanks to her kindness. Margaret has proven to be a responsible and honest person.

She comes to Yehu Microfinance once again to buy dairy products, drinks, food, vegetables, and other kinds of products to sell in her business in order to offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, drinks, food, vegetables, and other kinds of products to sell

loans.name: Luwali's Group

texts.en: Luwali is a 45-year-old dryland farmer and the father of five children. His wife is also a farmer, but their agricultural endeavors do not earn enough money to fulfill the family's needs. Luwali is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because he heard from other KOMAZA farmers that "KOMAZA will uplift the life standard of the farmers." With the profits from his tree farm, Luwali plans to educate his children and start additional businesses. He intends to purchase an ox for plowing, and goats which will make him money from selling manure.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support for his tree farm.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, who runs a charcoal store from her home, has established clients, good income, and good personal and business references. She is a hard-working woman and an excellent client of ours and of other financial institutions. She is applying for this loan to buy charcoal to sell in her store. By offering the best quality, she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rickson

texts.en: Rickson is taking out another Kiva loan, of KES 50,000. Currently he works for himself and is seeking by means of this loan to carry out maintenance on his motor vehicle. The trips he makes are for passenger transport. He is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: to maintain his passenger-transport vehicle.

loans.name: Vigen

texts.en:
Vigen has worked in one of the Armenian construction companies as a builder, but his salary was very low, and he couldn't cover even his own costs. So, he decided to create his own business. 

He built on his property a shop where he has run a fish-trading business up to now. This activity was profitable and soon he expanded the volume of his sales. Vigen has many clients in Ijevan city and receives much profit. Now Vigen is a successful young businessman. 

Vigen is 25 years old and lives in Ijevan city with his parents and sister. His mother and sister don't work. Vigen’s father helps him in his trading occupation. Vigen and his father transfer the fish from Ejmiadzin city with their own car and resell it in their fish shop. With income from the fish-trading business, Vigen supports his family’s needs; he has bought furniture and some electronics.

A Kiva loan will help Vigen to construct the second floor of his shop. He wants to expand his business more and hopes to receive more profit from his business.

loans.use: to construct the second floor of his shop.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo, who is married, has seven school-going children, owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water, but her greatest challenge is school fees and food for her children. She is applying for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy bags of onions, tomatoes, potatoes, bananas and cabbages for sale in her business, to raise the standard of her business, even though her business faces the challenge of seasonality.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions, tomatoes, potatoes, bananas and cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Stephen Kundu

texts.en: Stephen is 45 years old, married, and has four children whom he supports. His spouse contributes to the family income. He has been running the business for a period of about five years, with an income of KES 17,000 a month. This is his sixth loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous one. He hopes to give his children a quality education and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.ru: Навбахор очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети Насибулло, Фатулло и Кибрис еще не совершеннолетние. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Навбахор долго ждала, что муж отправит ей деньги, и она и ее дети будут жить на эти деньги. Однако до сих пор ее муж не отправляет деньги для содержания семьи. Итак, Навбахор решила организовать свой бизнес. Она с детства любила печь разные выпечки и помогала маме. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес производством разнообразных кондитерских изделий. Она хочет печь пироги, торты и печенья, так как кондитерские изделия имеют большой спрос на местном рынке. Она обучилась в курсе "Добейся Успеха" организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ в сумме 1200 сомони для покупки печки и сырья для производства кондитерских изделий. Этот займ поможет бедной женщине, как Навбахор организовать бизнес и найти источник дохода. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Navbahor is a very hard working woman.  She is married and is raising three children, Nasibullo, Fatullo, and Kibris, who are all still minors.   Her husband is a migrant laborer in the Russian Federation.  Navbahor waited a long time for her husband to send them money, and she was expecting that the family could live on that money.  However, her husband still has not sent any money to support the family.  And so, Navbahor decided to start her own business.     

Navbahor has loved to bake since childhood, when she used to help her mother.  Navbahor is planning to start a business in producing various cakes and sweets.  She wants to bake pies, cakes, and biscuits since there is a strong demand for them at the local market.  She studied in the program  "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead" organized by the Association of Business Women, and she earned a certificate.  

Navbahor is requesting a loan of 1200 somoni to buy an oven and the baking ingredients to start her business.  This loan will help a poor woman start her own business and find a source of income.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an oven and baking ingredients to start a new business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma de 24 años de edad esta casada con Wilder y tiene una hija de 4 años juntos viven en la casa construida a base de adobe.Desde muy niña aprendió gracias a sus padres el oficio de la producción y mantenimiento de cacao orgánico,ella apoyaba en labores básicas para posteriormente brindar apoyo de manera integral en las diversas tareas en beneficio de las plantaciones de cacao.Al casarse recibió de sus padres unos terrenos agrícolas en calidad de herencia para así continuar sembrando cacao, cuenta con el firme apoyo de su esposo quien realiza el mantenimiento respectivo a sus plantaciones con el objetivo de obtener buenas mazorcas a fin de campaña .
Con el paso de los años espera seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza para a adquirir mas parcelas de cacao e incursionar en otros rubros productivos tales como barbasco y palillo.
Muestra un profundo agradecimiento por la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo con el cual pueda desempeñar sus labores productivas y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Vilma requiere contar con S/. 2,000  soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo y abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Vilma, 24, is married to Wilder and has a four-year-old daughter. They live in an adobe house. As a girl, Vilma learned how to produce organic cacao from her parents. She first helped with basic tasks and later was involved in the many tasks integral to producing quality cacao. When she married, she inherited from her parents land on which she could continue growing cacao. She has her husband's full support, as he maintains the plantings so that they have quality pods at harvest time.

Vilma expects to keep working with her characteristic motivation to acquire more land to grow cacao and to grow other crops such as mullein and string beans. She is very grateful for the chance to receive a loan with which she can do her work. She promises to make her payments on time. Vilma needs S/. 2,000 soles to buy nursery seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy nursery seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana De 30 años es madre de dos niñas de 13 años y 7 años respectivamente con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler.Se desempeña como productora de cacao y café orgánico en su localidad.Posee unos terrenos que le fueron cedidas desde muy joven por sus padres para que tenga una herramienta de trabajo y puede mantener a su familia.Todos los días  debe de madrugar y después de enviar a sus hijas al colegio se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas en donde desempeña diversas tareas de mantenimiento productivo tales como son el deshierbo, aplicación de abono orgánico,entre otros. Son tareas esenciales que debe desempeñar de manera constante ya que de ello depende la calidad productiva que posteriormente expenderá a los mercados, por ello cuenta constantemente con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y está agradecida por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea contar con S/.2,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores y proceder con el segundo deshierbo de maleza de sus arboles de cacao.
texts.en:
Viviana, 30, is the mother of two daughters, ages 13 and 7, who live with her in a well-built, rented house. She grows cacao and organic coffee. She inherited land from her parents when she was young. The land provides work so that she can support her family. She wakes early every morning, and after seeing her children off to school, she heads to her fields to do different maintenance tasks such as weeding and spreading organic fertilizer. 

These essential tasks must be done continuously to ensure that her output is up to market quality, and, therefore, she always needs local workers. This is her first loan cycle with Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make her payments on time. Viviana needs S/.2,000 nuevos soles to hire workers to do the second weeding of her cacao plantings.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.en:
Fayzullo is kind a man. This is the first loan for him with the IMON organization, but his life and business background give people belief in his kindness and decency. This kind man lives with his family in the village. He has a lovely wife, who works as a housewife, and four children. Some of Fayzullo's children are adult and some of them are school-aged. He is only the only bread-winner in the family. 

Fayzullo has been busy with animal husbandry for four years, and his business makes him glad. He buys cattle, cares of them for a number of months, and resells at a higher price. He has a good place for cattle, and that’s why his cattle are fat. Fayzullo sells his cattle in the local market and has a lot of customers. 

He wants to develop his business further and maximize his profit, because the cost of raising his children gets more expensive each year. But he does not have the money to buy cattle and to increase the number of his cattle. That’s why Fayzullo is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni: to buy cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing new business

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is 31 years old, married and a mother of two children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 8,100. 

Mercyline was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 to buy additional stock for her shop, such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, cooking flour and so on. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children.

 Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she may be able to help improve the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her shop, such as cooking oil, washing powder, soft drinks, and cooking flour.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila de 41 años de edad , está casada con Teodoro y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de material noble .Teofila es  productora de cacao orgánico en su localidad ya que desde pequeña, el cultivo de este producto comercial fue el principal sustento de su familia , al tener conocimientos sólidos en el rubro y alcanzado la mayoría de edad recibió en calidad de herencia una terreno agrícola el cual trabajo con el apoyo de su esposo, logrando así obtener un ingreso fijo para el futuro de su familia.Se siente muy a gusto por la manera de trabajo que desempeña siendo una labor muy sacrificada ,no obstante debe de contar desde ya con capital de respaldo para las diversas tareas de mantenimiento que se debe brindar a las plantas de cacao.
Tiene un principal inconveniente en cuanto al transporte de sus productos desde sus parcelas hasta los mercados para su posterior venta debido a la distancia necesita un vehículo de carga para el respectivo transporte de su mercadería .Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y agradece la oportunidad brindada razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea contar con S/.2,000  soles y complementar su capital para comprarse un vehículo moto carguero con el cual pueda transporta sus semillas de cacao.
texts.en:
Teofila, 41, is married to Teodoro and has five children who live with them in their well-built house. Teofila produces organic cacao, which is the way her family has supported itself since she was a girl. After learning the skills of this business and reaching adulthood, she inherited land, which she works with her husband to earn a steady income for their family's future. She likes her work, though it is very difficult. She requires capital to perform the various maintenance tasks of producing cacao.

Teofila has had a problem transporting her crops from her land to the markets because the trip is quite long. She needs a vehicle to deliver her merchandise. This is her first loan cycle with Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make her payments on time. She needs S/.2,000  soles to buy a vehicle to take her cacao seeds to market.

loans.use: to buy a transport vehicle.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 52 years old, married, and a mother of four children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 11,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of KES. 20,000, to buy animal feed. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to help pay school fees for her grandchildren.

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming, with a view of increasing her income to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 55 años de edad , esta casado con Albina y tiene 3 hijos mayores con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Alejandro desempeña actividades agrícolas desde hace 18 años razón por la cual se dedica a la  producción de cacao . Por lo general el suele desempeñar sus labores  con su familia y en raras ocasiones convoca a trabajadores del lugar.Le agrada mucho el tema de tratamiento de las plantaciones de cacao ya que considera es un producto muy rentable y de fácil cosecha teniendo en cuenta que sus parcelas son tierras arcillosas que favorecen una buena calidad de su producto.
En un monitoreo detallado de sus parcelas ha notado que ya existen árboles de cacao que se encuentran desfasados y por consiguiente no producirán mas frutos en la próxima temporada, es por ello que desea reemplazarlo por injertos y almacigos y así sacarle el máximo provecho a sus tierras adicionando a ello la compra de abono orgánico indispensable para garantizar frutos de calidad.Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y esta muy agradecido por esta oportunidad y ademas de compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con los S/.2,000 soles realizará la compra de abono orgánico y plantas de almacigo.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 55, is married to Albina and has three grown children who live with him in their wood house. Alejandro has been farming for 18 years and produces cacao. Usually he and his family do the all the work, though on occasion he hires local workers. He likes to grow cacao because the business is profitable and the harvest is easy. His clay-rich land yields a quality product.

On careful examination of his land, he noticed that some of the plantings are old and will not produce pods next season. He wants to replace them with grafting and nursery seedlings to get the best yield from his land. He also needs to buy organic fertilizer, which is essential to producing quality pods. This is his second loan cycle with Kiva. He is very grateful for the opportunity and promises to make his payments on time. With a loan of S/.2,000 soles, he will buy organic fertilizer and nursery seedlings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and nursery seedlings.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is a single man living with his parents and three siblings. He’s a 21-year-old hard worker looking to help his father satisfy the family's needs. Hadi has many years of experience in his present job. He’s an independent painter who works on whatever clients need. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results ever. He’s known for being well-organized and on time. 

Today, Hadi is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas S.A.L. to purchase new scaffolding for his business. This will definitely facilitate his business operations. In the near future, he looks to take more projects, maybe outside the country if this will help him collect added income.

loans.use: to purchase new scaffolding for his business.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es una mujer independiente de 35 años ,sin hijos pero aun con la gran responsabilidad de brindarles de apoyar a sus padres con quienes vive en su casa de material noble. Doris se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y gracias a su negocio ha logrado apoyar a sus hermanos menores en los gastos que generan sus estudios superiores, haciendo  que se sienta muy motivada por los logros que van obteniendo. Cabe destacar que el hecho de tener su negocio ubicado en la parte mas concurrida de su distrito  le beneficia de manera considerable ya que tiene buena clientela. .Este es su primera experiencia con Kiva, motivo por el cual agradece la oportunidad y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.4,000  soles con el cual comprara productos comestibles tales como sacos de arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado, enlatados de frutas, leche, entre otros.
texts.en: Doris is a 35 year old single woman without children. However, she has taken on the great responsibility of providing support to her parents who live in her high quality home. Doris works selling groceries and, thanks to her business, she has provided support to her younger brothers to pay the expenses that  their advanced schooling is generating. She feels very motivated by the accomplishments they are obtaining. She notes the fact that her business is located in the busiest part of her district which benefits her considerably because she has good customers. This is her first experience with Kiva. She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make her payments on time. For this opportunity she seeks $1550 which she will use to buy groceries such as sacks of rice, sugar, canned fish, preserved fruit, and milk, among other items.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.en:
Bozorgul is a woman who helps everyone who is ill. She is a nurse at the local hospital, and has worked there for more than 6 years. Many people of her region know her as kind and clever woman. 

She is married, and her husband has migrated to Russia. They have five children, who Bozorgul brings up alone because her husband has been in Russia for many years. Her salary is small and it is not enough to improve the family's living condition. 

Her house is in awful condition, and she must repair it. Her children are at risk daily to live in these conditions, which is why she came to IMON asking for a loan of 4000 TJS. Bozorgul would use the money to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. She needs and awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paint for repairing her family's house.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora (in the photo), age 21, is single, and lives with her parents and sister and brother in Phnom Penh suburb.  
 
Nora is now in her third year of her university in Phnom Penh, majoring in management. She wants to study more English, so she applied for her first Kiva loan in the amount of $900 to pay for her English language university fees. 
 
With English language university, Nora will study for five years. Hence, she will use money from the loan to pay for whole five years.

loans.use: to pay fee for her English language university.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad , esta casado con Maruja de 33 años , tiene 2 hijos y vive en una casa construida a base de adobe.José se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles ya que sentía que el campo era una actividad muy complicada para el y porque deseaba darle toda la atención posible a sus pequeños. Gracias a un local que alquila esta siempre presente en su negocio ganando a su vez muchas amistades que lo convierten en un vecino muy conocido en su barrio.Al hallarse en una buena temporada desea comprar productos de primera necesidad así como de algunos útiles escolares de diversas marcas con el fin de realizar una buena inversión abasteciendo a su negocio con compras al por mayor, generando así ganancias adicionales.
Sus objetivos económicos a largo plazo apuntan a realizar la compra de un lote y la posterior construcción de una vivienda.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, motivo por el cual se muestra muy agradecido por la oportunidad y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con los S/. 3,000 nuevos soles espera abastecer su negocio con víveres al por mayor consistente en arroz, azúcar, conservas y algunos útiles escolares.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and married to Maruja, who is 33.  They have two children and live in a house made from adobe. José works selling food products, since he thought farming was too complicated for him, and because he wanted to give as much attention as possible to his children.  He rented a store and is always at his business making many friends, which has made him a well-known person in his neighborhood.  

In order to be stocked for the season, he wants to purchase basic products such as different brands of school supplies.  In order to make a good investment, he wants to stock his store with wholesale purchases, so that he can earn additional income.   His long term objectives are to purchase a plot of land and build a house.  

This is his first loan with Kiva.  He is very grateful for the opportunity and promises to make his repayments on time.  With the 3000 nuevos soles that he has requested, he will stock his store with items bought at wholesale, including rice, sugar, canned goods, and school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 35 years old, married and a mother of one child. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling goods at her general store in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES. 14,466.

Susan was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES. 20,000 to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, washing powder, and cooking flour to sell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business. 

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her general store so that she may help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cooking oil, washing powder, and cooking flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and is a merchant; she’s had a snack bar for five years that’s in a good location, which is a good advantage because she has many customers that way.

Margaret is a very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead and continue to grow. She says that at the beginning, her business was small, but thanks to her work and arduous effort, she’s been able to grow and improve the family’s income.

She asks for the loan to buy ingredients like meat, noodles, tea, and rice, which she uses to make the food for her snack bar. She’s very grateful for this opportunity she’s getting, since it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, noodles, tea, and rice to make the food for her snack bar.

loans.name: Flenda

texts.en:
Flenda is 51 years old, a mother of four children who are 11, 13, 15 and 20 years old respectively. She is from Eregi Location in Vihiga County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Moris who is a businessman. 

She is a fish monger, a business she has been doing for the last 17 years. She makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. She will use her anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

Her hopes are to provide for her family with a better future and to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Phearann

texts.en:
Phearann (pictured here), age 19, is single, and lives with his parents in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  
   
Phearann is now in his first semester and second year of his university in Phnom Penh, majoring in Banking and Finance. He will go to his second semester and second year of his university. 
 
Hence, he requests a loan in the amount of $200 to pay for his second semester and second year of his university.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a woman who has a good ability for managing a business. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is not a very lucky man, and he is not able to earn money. Matluba has been busy, selling DVD discs in the local market, for more than six years. Now, she plans to organize a new business producing and selling ice-cream. She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization, and she made perfect her knowledge about business. Her daughter will help her with the new business. She will produce ice-cream to sell in the local market. Beginning this month, it is a good season for the ice-cream business.

She is asking for a loan of 13,000 Somoni, which she will use to buy equipment for producing ice-cream. She awaits your support. This loan will help her to find a new source of income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy equipment for producing ice-cream, which will be her new business

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 23 years old. He lives in Batumi, in western Georgia, with his retired father, his brother Revaz and sister-in-law Irma, and a nephew who is going to school. Zaza requested a loan from local financial institutions, several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Zaza’s brother is working at a fuel station as an operator, and his sister-in-law works as a cashier at the local beer factory. They each get a small monthly income, but together they do not earn enough to feed the family and cover monthly expenses.
 
Recently, Zaza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The initiative envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to ordinary credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Zaza wants to open a car painting shop. He will rent a place and purchase all the needed equipment to paint cars. Zaza is a very hard-working man, and he wants to help his brother and sister-in-law in covering monthly living expenses of the family. He will work hard and earn a good profit. Part of the profit he will reinvest in the same business, for future expansion, and another part he will use currently, for the family's well-being

loans.use: To rent a place and purchase all the needed equipment for a new business, painting cars

loans.name: Silika

texts.en:
Silika is from Kisauni. She is a married woman, who has three children, all of whom attend school. She works selling fruits and vegetables, in a little shed at Kisauni. With sacrifice and dedication she has managed to get her three children ahead, with the help of her husband. She is a very hard-working woman. She says she always has worked, and she is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and have a bigger shed, to continue helping her family and her husband.

Silika is coming to Yehu microfinance for a loan.  She will use it to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots and onions, as well as seasonal fruits. These purchases will enable her to supply her business with top-quality produce to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots and onions, as well as seasonal fruits

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 53 year old man. He is married to Josephine, and they are blessed with four children who are grown up. He has a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been in this business for three years and makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

Alfred is taking a loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase meat for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to start a new business. He has a dream of running a successful business and taking care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase meat for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 34 year old man from Kondele in Kisumu city in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Everline, who is a teacher by profession, and has two children aged 10 and 5. He supports two people in his family.

For the past nine years, Paul has been operating a business selling fertilizers and animal feeds, which he makes from molasses. He earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. He is applying for his second loan to purchase more molasses. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business. He has a dream of making his business more stable.

loans.use: to purchase more molasses.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is from Kisauni. She makes a living buying and selling women's, men's and children's clothing. She is married; her husband is also a businessman who contributes to the family's needs. She and her husband live together in their own house along with their four children. Catherine is a very hardworking woman with very good references. She has been working in this business for 5 years.

Catherine is requesting this loan in order to buy cold-weather clothing since the season is upon her and she wants to offer a better variety of clothing to her customers. She is very grateful for this opportunity and notes that it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is from Kisauni. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She sells food from a food pantry in her home, and has built up an established clientele. She also grows and sells tomatoes, which are offered in her shop. She is able to generate a good income and has good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client. Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can restock her food pantry with milk, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase milk, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products.

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is a 45-year-old man from Mamboleo estate in Kisumu city. He is married man to Pamela and supports eight children in his family. He is self-employed in a welding business. He has been doing this work for the past 20 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 50,000.

Janes is applying for his third loan. He will use it to buy raw materials, like welding rods and iron bars in different categories, and to maintain his welding machines in good order. He will plow back the anticipated profit into the business.

He is hoping to expand his business's worth, so as to enable him to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase iron bars and welding rods, and to maintain his welding machines in good order

loans.name: Asnat

texts.en:
Asnat is a 40-year-old woman, who is married to Lambertus, age 42. He is a motorcycle taxi driver. She has three children: Hengky, 20 years old, Merlin, 14 years old and a junior high school student, and Juwinto, 11 years old and an elementary school student.
 
In order to generate more income, Asnat sells bean sprouts and rents a billiard table. She has been involved in selling bean sprouts since 1990. With her small capital, she initiated the business. She purchases 5 kg of green beans, as the raw material for the bean sprouts.

In order to improve the bean sprouts business, she has requested a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 3,000,000. She would like to spend the loan to buy green beans, which she will store as stock. She hopes that, through the loan assistance from TLM, she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green beans, to be stored as stock

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma's main source of income is selling firewood to her neighbors. She is currently living in Kisauni. Salma has been selling for more than two years and has a well-established group of customers who place orders with her. As a result, she is managing to make progress.

Salma is requesting this loan to buy firewood, because she has a special offer now that will enable her to make more profits, and continue helping her family. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, as it will benefit not only her, but also her family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to resell to her neighbors

loans.name: Winnie Njoki

texts.en:
Winnie has two children, who are aged 21 and 18 years. She is happy that the previous loan helped her to improve her business, as she had a lot of harvest from the maize seedlings that she had bought and planted using the loan funds.

Now, Winnie has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD. She will use it to enable her to buy more seedlings and fertilizers to use on her farm. She hopes to see her business do better, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica has been in the petty trading business for the past five years, in Hohoe. Veronica has received formal education, but only to junior high school.  She is married and has three children with her husband, who is a farmer. She normally assists her husband with the basic home needs, and some financial needs of the children who are in school. Her loan will be used to trade in the sale of plantain and cassava. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to buy more food items to resell, like plantain and cassava

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is happy about her previous loan, because it really helped her to buy sheep and, thus, made her business to thrive a lot. She has now applied for an education loan, to enable her to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to see her business expand in the near future, and also to ensure that her children get the best education.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cow meat (beef), cartons of tinned tomatoes, and cassava dough, for the preparation of food for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan to buy rice, green grams (mung beans), etc., to add to the stock in his grocery business. His business did much better after that investment, and he was able to gain new customers and meet their demands.

Peter has now applied for another loan, this one to enable him to diversify into farming, which is his secondary business. He wants to buy fertilizers and seedlings to enable him to do some planting. 

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kisauni. She is happily married and has children from her marriage. She has a small grocery store in her home, which she says she has been working in for five years. She says that it is doing very well, because she has good customers who always come to her business.

Hellen is requesting this loan, because she would like to stock her business with essential products, such as milk, baked goods, sugar, meat, and the like. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving, as it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to stock her business with essential products, such as milk, baked goods, sugar, meat, and the like

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Kwale County with her husband. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove trees throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. The local farmers have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families. 

Both Beatrice and her husband are farmers, and they have three children. She has been farming for forty-two years, and is currently growing oranges on her land. She is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because their hive technicians give very good service and teach people about beekeeping. She is also looking forward to eating some honey from her hives. Beatrice hopes to use the income generated from her hives to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is from Kisauni. She has a well-stocked store on the same corner as the settlement of that village. She states that she has a good customer base because her store has almost everything, and she treats her customers well. She says that one of her dreams is to expand her store and to one day be able to have a supermarket, with which she could attract more customers.

Jane is requesting the loan to buy food, drinks, vegetables and other goods to stock her business. She also comments that she is very grateful to Yehu Microfinance for having confidence in her because this opportunity from Yehu Microfinance is very important for her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, vegetables and other goods to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida has engaged in trading for more than 20 years. She lives with her husband, parents-in-law, daughter and son. Her husband is a taxi service driver, her daughter is a freshman at Yerevan State University, and her son also is a taxi driver and supports his father in his activity. 

Frida has had a very hard life. She got married too early. Frida and her husband didn't have any special skills, but they started to work when they were 18 years old and hadn’t any time to study. Frida’s parents-in-law helped them greatly, in their grandchildren's upbringing.

In 1990, the couple launched their food trading business. With the profit from their activity, they were able to sustain their family. In recent years Frida has been running a clothes trading business, also. She buys large quantities of clothes from Yerevan at wholesale centers, and she resells them in Sevan city at retail.

Frida needs 1,000,000 Armenian Dram to buy new spring-summer season, women's clothes for reselling. She will use the anticipated profit from this activity to pay her daughter's semester tuition and fees at university.

loans.use: To buy new sprig-summer season, women's clothes, to resell at retail

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en:
Mirza is 30 years old. He lives in Dimi village, Baghdati district, with his parents, brother and retired grandmother. Mirza requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They have 4 milk cows, 5 calves, a bull and 2 pigs. They also own a vineyard. The family milks the cows to make dairy products and also sells piglets. From the harvested grapes, they make wine and vodka. They have a truck and use it for distributing all the products locally at the markets.

Mirza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor. The rural poor do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Mirza wants to open a cement workshop to make cement blocks. He will purchase all the needed mounting and also cement and start making blocks. He will use the family truck for distributing them. 

Mirza hopes his new business will be profitable, and he will be able to earn additional income to help his family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed mounting and cement to start making blocks.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is 25 years old, and from Gaza. He is married and has one child.

He asked Ryada for this start-up loan, in order to start his business and have his own barber shop, after having gained five years' experience in the same field, working for someone else. Hashem will use the loan, specifically, to buy furniture and develop the space of the shop. His ambition is to have the biggest barber shop in the area, and to provide his family with a better life and his child with the best education.

Ryada's Start-up Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period, to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy furniture, in order to open his own barber shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has two school-going children. She rents a house with electricity, but without piped water. Her greatest challenges are food, school fees for her children and rent. She runs a vegetable stall, and her customers are people from her neighborhood.

Grace is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to buy enough vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for sale to her clients to satisfy their needs and also to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy enough vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Yololana Group

texts.en:
Yololana is a group of 10 farmers in Chwele District represented by Moses. The group has seven women and three men. Moses is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum, will be delivered to him on credit. Moses first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Moses joined One Acre Fund in order to receive input on loan.

Moses reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about nine bags of maize per acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested nine bags per half acre! He plans to use the money he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy more land. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Moses’s group members will take input loans of a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat, 22, lives with his parents in Vanadzor, Armenia. He has graduated from the Faculty of Ecology at Vanadzor State Pedagogical University. 

From time to time, Marat’s father goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad. Marat didn't continue his studies to receive a master’s degree because the family’s financial situation worsened at that time. It was a most difficult time for his family. He decided he needed to organize business activity that would help him meet his family's needs.  

Marat engaged in the perfume and household goods trading business and has been in that business for about a year. He buys a large amount of goods from Yerevan’s wholesale markets and transports them in a rented car to the trade centers of Lori region and Vanadzor. 

His business is going very well, and he is pleased. The profit from this activity is good, because there has been a great demand for perfumes in the Lori region in recent years, and they are sold in large volumes. Marat's parents are very proud of their only son and hope that, in the near future, he will reach a good financial level.

Marat has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy his own car to deliver goods, which will help him carry out his trading activity. He says he has spent much money on renting cars. Owning a new car will eliminate unnecessary costs.

loans.use: To buy his own car to deliver goods

loans.name: Joyna

texts.en:
Joyna is married and lives with her husband and three children. She has been married for years. Her husband is a driver.

Five years ago, Joyna began a small store in her home, from where her husband worked while she studied to be a teacher. Now, her entire family works in the store, which is the busiest and most important store in Kisauni.

With this loan, Joyna will buy merchandise, including soft drinks and daily staples, such as flour, herbs, noodles and rice. She will purchase these items in bulk to improve the store's inventory.

loans.use: buy merchandise in bulk, including soft drinks and daily staples, such as flour, herbs, noodles and rice.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is taking out another Kiva loan amounting to 50,000 KES to invest in a poultry business. He wants to dedicate time to selling poultry since it's a very profitable product, which has already helped improve his families daily quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius works as a fruit, vegetable and chicken seller in the area of Kisauni. 

He is a successful micro-business man with an established clientele, due to his friendliness with his customers. He has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person with his prior obligations with Yehu Microfinance.

He is asking for the loan to buy fruit and vegetables to stock up and have more variety to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel lives and farms in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make life difficult. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives and gathering additional income from the sale of their honey.

Ezekiel is married, and has three children. He has been farming for 21 years, and is currently growing oranges. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because their hives are well made and their hive technicians give great service. He also likes beekeeping because he enjoys eating honey. With the extra income generated from his hives Ezekiel hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 KES. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other garments because these are in high demand in this season. She is grateful for this opportunity, since it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: for the purchase of shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and other garments

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a very hardworking mother who is excelling in her business. Her last Kiva loan helped her give her children a quality life.

Amina is requesting another loan. She is asking for 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fish, cooking oil, firewood and spices to sell to her clients and improve her way of living for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil, firewood and spices to sell

loans.name: Rajwa

texts.en:
Rajwa, who appears in the photo, is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother to one son and two daughters.

For the past twenty years, Rajwa has had a sewing workshop, sewing clothes for customers, which has been a profitable project.

Rajwa is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing additional textiles to provide better quality to her loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Rajwa's income.

loans.use: To purchase textiles

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 21-year-old, single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a phone accessories store. He has been involved in this business for two years. However, he is young. He is the breadwinner who pushes himself to provide to his family. He is an incredibly hard-working man and, as a result, has a lot of experience. In addition, this store is the main source of his income.

Recently, he took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB, in order to purchase phone accessories and recharge cards for expanding his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories and recharge cards, for expanding his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a forty-five year old mother of seven children. She grows cowpeas, maize and cassava to support her family. Her husband is retired from the army. 

Elizabeth's agricultural ventures are challenged by pests that destoy the crops and a lack of capital to purchase pesticides and fertilizer. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, as she says, "KOMAZA is helping farmers to grow economically by planting trees to generate money." 

With the profits from her tree farm, Elizabeth intends to educate her children and to start agricultural businesses such as dairy farming or poultry keeping.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is 24-years-old and lives with his parents, grandmother and sister. His father is a pedagogue, his mother is a doctor and his sister is a law-adviser. 
After his military service Artyom launched his own business.  He rented a store, did some repair work and started a small shop, where he sells office supplies and household goods. The business has been successful as his shop is in a remote place in Ijevan City and is the only way for citizens to do their purchases without wasting more time. Of course, he has a large number of clients which contribute to a large profit from this business. So Artyom has decided to expand his business volume and wants to sell food.  At first he started to sell some candies and sweets in his shop. This experiment has shown that he could easily sell other food items in his shop.
 
For this pursuit it requires that Artyom have a capacity to maintain the food items in suitable conditions. His profit from the business is not sufficient for this and Artyom needs more financial means to buy some refrigerators and construct a storage area/warehouse.  For this Artyom is asking for a Loan from Kiva Lenders of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy refrigerators for his shop and construct a storage area/warehouse, which will help him to sell food items in his shop

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is married and has four school-going children. She owns a house without electricity or piped water. Her greatest challenges are fees for her children and food. She has a business selling dry fish and she also sells coconuts and firewood. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy two sacks of coconuts, fish, cooking oil and firewood for frying fish for sale so that she can buy her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of coconuts, fish, cooking oil and firewood for frying fish for sale.

loans.name: Sharaly

texts.en:
Sharaly is 42-years-old. He is a hard-working man with a great desire to get ahead. Mavzuna is his partner. They have 4 children they love very much, Sulaymon, who is 26 years old; Safargul who is 24 years old; Sorbon who is 17 years, and Soniya who is 7 years old. They live together in a big house.

Sharaly sells a variety of electronic products, which he stores in the local market. He began working this way over 7 years ago because he needed to earn money. Currently, his cousin helps him to purchase his merchandise. 

This is his ninth loan with IMON, and he is grateful for its financial support in helping him to realize his plans. He is asking for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy goods for widening the assortment of his merchandise. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy products to widen the assortment of the goods he sells

loans.name: Hadie

texts.en:
She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Hadie is asking for another Kiva loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers. 

She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products to stock her cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and material for work.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa's dream has always been to have a well-supplied general store in order to be able to generate more income and thus be able to have a better quality of life for her and her whole family. With her effort, work and dedication she succeeded, reaching her goals without any type of problem. Today, she has the shop she dreamed of and she is requesting this loan in order to be able to supply it with drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: able to supply her shop with drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Kwale county, in southern Kenya. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passionfruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

James has been farming for 45 years and is currently growing oranges on his land. He is married with six children and his wife is currently retired. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because he trusts their Hive Technicians to visit his farm regularly and to do good work repairing the hives and harvesting honey.

This is James' first Kiva loan and he plans to use the extra income generated from his hives to buy materials to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 24 years old. He is single and has been a motorcyclist for two years. 

He has requested a loan to make preparation of his motorbike for ease of use in the transport of passengers. He plans to use the profits for buying a plot of land, on which he will build a house.

loans.use: to make preparation of his motorbike for ease of use in the transport of passengers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 51 years old. He lives in Borjomi district with his 51-year-old wife, Eter and 28-year-old son, Dimitri. Vazha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is from real estate. Vazha owns a commercial space in the center of Borjomi which is rented. However, the rental amount is not enough to cover the family's monthly expenses. 

Vazha requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan programs envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products and being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Vazha will purchase a truck. He already has collected most of the amount and is missing part of it for purchasing. He will be working on transporting different kinds of cargo and earn additional income for the family. This will help them to cover all the monthly expenses and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 45 years old. She is a widow with six children, five of whom attend school. She's been selling beers and sodas for a period of seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beers and sodas for sale. She is planning to use the profits for reinvesting in the bar business because she has seen that the demand for alcohol is high.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is married and has five children who go to school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water, and her greatest expense is food.

Zainabu has a food stall, and she wants to expand her business to have a better range of customers and satisfy their needs. That is why she is asking for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy beans, vegetable oil, wheat flour, and rice to give a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beans, vegetable oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack lives and farms in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps close to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Isaack is excited to work with Honey Care, as he thinks their Hive Technicians give good service, and he is happy to be a beekeeper because he enjoys eating honey. He has been farming for fifty-six years, and is currently growing oranges on his land. He is married, and his wife currently works as a housekeeper. He and his wife have nine children, and plan to use some of the income generated from their hives to pay for school fees. 

This is Isaack's first Kiva loan. In the future, he hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has two children. She owns a house with electricity but without piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and her children's school fees.

She has a vegetable stall and she is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy sacks of onions, cabbages, potatoes, fruits and kale for sale to meet the needs of her customers and satisfy the needs of her family from the cash she gets after the sales.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions, cabbages, potatoes, fruits and kale for sale.

loans.name: Priscille

texts.en:
Priscille is 30 years old. She is married with three children.

With the loan, she wants to add more foodstuffs for sale such as rice, cooking oil, salt, and soaps. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more retail items such as soaps, cooking oil and salt to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives and farms in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives and gathering additional income from the sale of their honey.

Faith is married, and has four children. Her husband is also a farmer, and they are currently nurturing a tree plantation on their land. Faith has been farming for thirty-five years, and is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as she enjoys eating honey. She wants to work with Honey Care Africa because their hives are well made and their hive technicians give great service.

This is Faith's first loan, and she plans to use the extra income generated from her hives to build additions to her house. In the future, she hopes to invest in her land and expand her farming activities.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Kazar

texts.en:
Kazar is 29 years old. He lives in Ninotsminda District with his 26-year-old wife, two children (twins), parents and two sisters. Kazar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success.
