She has been in this business for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort she devotes to her business each day. She also continues raising and selling small animals, as this is how she supports her family. 

The member is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is grateful for the support granted to her, and promises to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora María Erlinda de 70  años de edad, no  tiene hijos que dependan de ella, es madre soltera, tiene  casa propia y vive en la comunidad  de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña María Erlinda se dedica desde hace 41 años  a la venta de abarrotería,  s un una cliente que ha luchado durante varios años casi toda su vida se ha dedicado  al comercio y a la venta de leche, renta de casas y apartamentos.
Doña María Erlinda está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotería como ser: carnes, pollo, embutidos, granos básicos, leche, mantequilla, margarina, detergentes, jabón, jugos, refrescos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y desea que su negocio crezca y también desea mejorar más su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Febrero del 2013
texts.en:
María Erlinda is 70 years old, and she is a single mother of adult children who are not dependents. She has her own home, and she lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. 

María has owned a grocery store for 41 years, and she is a client that has struggled throughout the years. Almost all of her life she has been doing business selling milk, and renting houses and apartments. María is requesting a loan for purchases for the grocery store such as: meat, chicken, sausages, basic staple foods, milk, butter, margarine, detergents, soap, juices, sodas, etc. 

With the support of this loan, she aims to improve her income, and she is very happy to keep working with Prisma. María wishes her to grow her business and improve her home. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  February 2013

loans.use: purchase meat, chicken, sausages, basic staple foods, milk, butter, margarine, detergents, soap, juices, sodas, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1993. She has a little child. Her husband is a carpenter. His income is 5,000,000 VND per month. Phuong collects iron scraps to earn a living. She gains 4,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to collect more iron scraps to recycle.

Other members who are part of Phuong's group include the following:
 
Diep was born in 1992. She has a child. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry. 

Bang was born in 1993. She sells chicken eggs to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more poultry eggs to sell in the market.

loans.use: to collect more iron scraps to recycle.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Nelson  de 41  años de edad, tiene un hijo que depende de él, vive con su esposa, en su casa  ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 01 año  al negocio de venta de calzado.
Don Nelson sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos que lo visitan en su negocio y también sale con su esposa a las aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su comunidad a vender este producto.
Don Nelson está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de sandalias, zapatos, tenis, etc. de mujer y hombre con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende surtir un poco mas su negocio y por ende obtener más ingresos que le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don Nelson su sueño es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Nelson is 41 years old and has a son who depends on him. He lives with his wife in their home, located in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. He has been in the business of selling footwear for a year.

Nelson's customers are friends and neighbors who visit him at his shop. He and his wife also go out to the villages and rural settlements neighboring their community to sell this product.

Nelson is requesting a loan to buy men's and women's sandals, shoes, sport shoes, etc.  With the help of the loan, he intends to stock his business a bit more, and thereby obtain more income, which will help him to improve his quality of life. Nelson's dream is to improve his house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  February 2013.

loans.use: To buy sandals, shoes, sport shoes, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona de 46  años de edad, tiene dos  hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa ubicada en la comunidad de  San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Petrona se dedica desde hace 06  años  a la actividad de venta de sal y plátano verde, sus clientes son los amigos que tiene ganadería ya que la sal que vende junto con la ayuda de su esposo es para uso de ganado también vende en su carro plátano verde para tajadas estos los distribuye en pulperías.
Doña Petrona es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que desea sacar adelante a su familia.
Doña Petrona está solicitando el préstamo para ajustar a comprar un terreno que le venden cerca de su propiedad, con el apoyo del préstamo espera mejorar un poco su nivel de vida al adquirir un nuevo bien para su familia. 
Doña Petrona su  sueño es tener más terreno donde poder cultivar.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013
texts.en:
Pertrona is 46-years-old. She has children that depend on her. She lives with her husband in her home located in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. 

Pertrona has worked for 6 years in the sale of salt and green bananas. Her clients are friends that have cattle. She sells the salt with the help of her husband for the use of livestock. She also sells in her cart green bananas slices, which she distributes to grocery stores.

Petrona is a hardworking woman and enterprising that wants to get ahead with her family.  Petrona is requesting the loan to be able to purchase a plot of land that will be sold to her near her home. With the help of the loan she hopes to slightly improve her standard of living and provide for her family. Petrona’s dream is to have more land where she can cultivate.  February 2013.

loans.use: to purchase land for her home

loans.name: G.s El Jicaral Group

texts.es:
La señora  Nubia   de 26  años de edad,  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo en  casa de un familiar, en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Nubia tiene 01 año de dedicarse a  la  venta de tortillas, tamales de pollo y res, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan en  su casa y también sale a vender de forma ambulante por las aldeas y caseríos aledaños a su comunidad.
Doña Nubia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal. con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que mejoren sus ingresos y por ende mejore un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio mandara a sus hijos a la escuela.
Doña Nubia su sueño es tener su propia casa y su negocio de tortillas bien acondicionado.
Doña Nubia es la líder del grupo y al igual que sus compañeros necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios y así mejorar un poco sus ingresos y sus negocios.
Doña Jessica vende tortillas y paletas.
El Joven Franklin su negocio es una pulpería.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Nubia, who is 26 years old, has two children who depend on her. She lives with her husband in the house of a relative in a community of San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras.

For a year, Doña Nubia has been selling tortillas and chicken and beef tamales. Her customers are friends and people who visit her daily in her home, and she also goes out to sell as a street vendor in the villages and hamlets surrounding her community.

Doña Nubia is applying for the loan in order to purchase corn, firewood, and lime. With the help of this loan she hopes to improve her income and thus improve a little bit her quality of life and that of her family. With the earnings obtained from her business, she will send her children to school.

Doña Nubia's dream is to have her own house and have her tortillas business well equipped.

Doña Nubia is the leader of the group. Like Doña Nubia, her companions need the loan to invest in their businesses and thus improve a little their income and their businesses.

Doña Jessica sells tortillas and popsicles.

The young Franklin has a grocery store business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo, de 52  años, vive con su esposa , en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta leña, botellas de leche de vaca y sus derivados como leche, cuajada, queso y también vende ganado.
Don Arturo sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, donde sale a vender a diferentes comunidades de donde vive. 
Don Arturo sus clientes son todas las personas que a diario le  visitan, está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de dos terneros que le están vendiendo se los están dando bien cómodos y quiere aprovechas la oferta.
Don Arturo su sueño tener una hacienda llena de muchos animales.
texts.en:
Arturo, 52, lives with his wife in their home located in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. He sells firewood, bottled cow's milk, and dairy products such as milk, curds and cheese, and he also sells cattle.

Arturo's sales are from Monday to Sunday, when he goes out to sell to various communities in the area where he lives. Arturo's customers are all the people who come to see him every day. 

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy two calves that they are selling him. They are being offered at a good price, and he wants to take advantage of the bargain.

Arturo's dream is to have a ranch with many animals.

loans.use: To buy calves for his business.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
La Joven Iris de 28  años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de tortillas en donde las tiene de encargo.
Iris entrega las tortillas que elabora a diferentes restaurantes de la zona y también a varios vecinos que viven cerca de su casa, vende encargo, es muy trabajadora y también le gusta salir adelante.
Iris está solicitando el préstamo para compra de cargas de maíz, leña y cal ya que se las están dando a buen precio y por la demanda que tiene de clientes requiere comprarlo para así tenerlo almacenado.
Iris su sueño mejorar su casa de habitación.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Iris is a young woman who is 28 years of age. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. Iris sells tortillas based on the orders she receives.

She delivers tortillas to different restaurants in the area and also to several neighbors who live near her house. Iris sells based on orders. She is hardworking and enjoys getting ahead.

Iris is requesting a loan so that she can buy shipments of corn, firewood, and lime at a good price. The demand from her customers requires that she buy these items and store them. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza, de 38  años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser perros calientes, enchiladas, tacos, pastelitos, entre otros,  sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
Doña Maritza sale a vender sus golosinas y cuando hay fiestas, ferias, ahí va para así poder tener mejores ventas, su esposo también tiene su propio negocio. 
Doña Maritza está solicitando  el préstamo para comprar verduras como ser patastes, chiles, cebollas, plátanos, remolachas, lechugas, jilotes, carnes, etc. para preparar sus golosinas, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad financiera y mejorar un poco su situación económica y la de su familia.  
Doña Maritza su sueño es tener su propio local para dejar de vender ambulantemente.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza is 38 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. Maritza sells snacks such as hot dogs, enchiladas, turnovers, and other items. She conducts her sales Monday through Sunday.

Sra. Maritza sells snacks whenever there are festivals and fairs, which helps her to generate better sales. Her husband also has his own business. She is requesting a loan to buy produce such as chayote squash, chili peppers, onions, bananas, beets, lettuce, corn, as well as meat and other items for preparing her dishes. With the support of this loan, she will be able to fulfill her financial needs and gradually improve her family’s economic situation.

Doña Maritza dreams of having her own shop so that she can stop selling as a street vendor.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy chayote squash, chili peppers, onions, bananas, beets, lettuce, corn, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El señor Modesto, de 56  años, vive con su esposa y un  hijos, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de ganadería, donde saca leche en botella para ir a vender así como también cuajada, requesón y otro derivados.
Don Modesto sus ventas son de lunes a domingo en donde vende todo lo que pueda sus clientes son amigos que a diario le visitan en su negocio.
Don Modesto está solicitando el préstamo para compra de una cría de terneros la cual se la están dando cómodas y el sabe que puede mejorar mas su negocio haciendo esta inversión y con el apoyo del préstamo satisfacer las necesidades financiera de su familia y mejorar un poco su situación económica.
Don Modesto su sueño es seguir trabajando para poder siempre tener su ganado.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Sr. Modesto is 56 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and children in the community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. Modesto is a livestock breeder, but he also sells bottled milk, curds, cottage cheese, and other dairy products.

Don Modesto conducts his sales Monday through Sunday. His customers include friends who visit his business on a daily basis. He is requesting a loan in order buy calves to raise. Modesto knows that this investment will improve his business, so the support provided with this loan will satisfy the financial needs of his family and gradually improve his economic situation.

Don Modesto dreams of continuing his work with cattle.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – February 2013

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Liliana Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad y dos de 18 y 14  años que estudian en universidad y  colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es carpintero.

Doña Liliana con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella instala un pequeño puesto los fines de semana en el centro de la ciudad para así aprovechar los días de feria que es cuando más personas llegan al lugar, también vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días,   deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta porque con él primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Junín" communal bank meets every two weeks in Junín canton. This place is known for its friendly and hard-working people, and because the best liquor in the province and in Ecuador is distilled there. 

This is where Liliana lives. She is 44, married and they have four children. Two of them adults, and the others, 18 and 14, go to university and high school. Two of her children still live with her. Her husband is a carpenter.

With the intention of earning something on her own account, and this way being able to get ahead in life, Liliana sells all types of clothing. She sets up a small stand on weekends in the center of the city to take advantage of the market days, which is when more people come. She also sells from her home, where she has a small shop. 

She works every day. She sells to her customers on credit and collects every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every two weeks, or monthly, according to what she needs. She has been working in this business for more than 10 years, and it is going very well.  

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 10 years, and likes it because with the first loan she started her business.

Her dream is to see her children finish their educations and become fine professionals.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Ramona Albertina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Ramona, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, la menor tiene 20 años y estudia en universidad y es la que aun vive con ella.

Doña Ramona para poder salir adelante  con los gastos del hogar y con esto poder pagar los estudios de su hija  se dedica a preparar y vender alimentos, ella tiene un restaurante  en su casa en el cual prepara diversos platos a elección de sus clientes, también para los desayunos ella prepara tortillas, bollos, empanadas  los cuales son muy apetecidos por sus clientes que a diario asisten a su restaurante y por lo cual ha ganado mucha clientela, trabaja todos los días  desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las tres de la tarde. Trabaja sola y tiene su comedor por más de 20  años, desde que falleció su esposo esta es la fuente de ingresos que le permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda el banco.
 
Su sueño es que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank Junín meets every two weeks in the Junín canton. This area is known for its friendly and hard-working people and because the best spirits in the province and in Ecuador are distilled there.

In this place lives Señora Ramona. She is 62 years old. Her beloved husband died a number of years ago, and she was left a widow, but from this relationship she had five children who are now adults. The youngest is 20 years old and studies at a university and is the one who still lives with her.

Doña Ramona, in order to be able to get ahead with the household expenses and along with that be able to pay for her daughter's studies, prepares and sells food. She has a restaurant in her house, where she prepares a variety of dishes for selection by her customers. She also prepares tortillas, rolls, and empanadas for breakfasts, and they are very much sought after by her customers, who come to her restaurant every day, and for this reason she has won many customers. She works every day from 6 am until 3 in the afternoon. She works alone and has had her dining area for more than 20 years. Since her husband died, this has been the source of income that allows her to advance.

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other foodstuffs to prepare her foods. She has been in the communal bank since its beginning, and she likes it because of the help that the bank offers her.

Her dream is to see her daughter finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Noemi Argentina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora Noemí, tiene 44 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa de los cuales tres estudian en universidad.

Doña Noemi trabaja en la iglesia de la localidad donde gana un sueldo mensual, pero además de esto ella se dedica al comercio, en su casa tiene una pequeña distribuidora de productos químicos como detergentes, cloro, desinfectantes entre otros productos, en este negocio le ayudan sus hijos ya que ella tiene que cumplir con un horario de trabajo en la iglesia. Este negocio es muy bueno ya que son pocos los lugares que ofrecen estos productos, ella lleva tres años con este negocio y le va muy bien, con esto ella puede sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales tienen muchos gastos en sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cloro, detergentes, desinfectantes y otros productos químicos. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos  terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank Junín meets every two weeks in the Junín canton. This area is known for its friendly and hard-working people and because the best spirits in the province and in Ecuador are distilled there.

In this place lives Señora Noemi. She is 44 years old. She is separated from her husband, but from this relationship she had 6 children who are already adults. Four of them still live in her house; three of them study at the university.

Doña Noemi works in the local church, where she earns a monthly salary, but in addition to this she has a business. In her house she has a little distributorship for chemical products such as detergents, bleach, and disinfectants, among other products. Her children help her with this business, since she has to comply with working hours at the church. This business is very good, since there are few places that offer these products. She has had this business for three years, and it is going very well for her. With this she can raise her children, who have many expenses for their studies.

She is going to use this loan to buy bleach, detergents, disinfectants and other chemical products. She has been in the communal bank for two years, and she likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans.

Her dream is to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy chlorine, detergents, disinfectants, and other chemical products.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Junín se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque se destila el mejor aguardiente en la provincia y en el Ecuador.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos de 18, 17, 13  años que estudian en colegio. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha ayudado en su negocio y porque le han permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Doña María con la finalidad de salir adelante sola con sus hijos con la ayuda de ellos hizo unos corrales en los cuales se dedica a la cría de chanchos y aves de corral.  Ella compra los chanchos cuando están pequeños los alimenta por unos tres a cuatro meses y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta la zona, lleva más de 8 años con esta actividad la misma que le permite salir adelante honradamente.

La señora María está repitiendo el crédito ya que es la única forma que ella tiene para salir adelante, actualmente tiene más de 200 pollos y necesita del crédito para comprar alimentos y medicinas para estos ya que es esta época se enferman mucho y no quiere tener perdidas. Con las ganancias del crédito anterior ella mejoro los corrales y ahora ya puede meter más pollos y así tener más ganancias en el futuro. Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su vida. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The village bank Junín meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín, a place know for its hardworking and friendly people as well as the best distilled liquor in the province and in Ecuador.

Here lives Maria, 34, a single mother of three children ages 18,17 and 13 who are in school. She has been with the village bank for three cycles and likes it because the loans have helped her with her business and allowed her to get her kids ahead.

With the goal of taking care of her children alone, Maria and her children made some corrals where she raises pigs and poultry. She buys the pigs when they are small and feeds them for 3-4 months and later sells them to buyers who come to the area. She has been doing this for 8 years and it allows her to make an honest living.

Maria is repeating her loan because it's the only way that she can get ahead. She currently has more than 200 chickens and needs a loan to buy food and medicine for them because they get sick a lot during this season and she doesn't want any losses. With the earnings from the previous loan she improved the corrals and can now fit more chickens, and therefore have more future profits. This loan is to buy food and medicine for both the chickens and the pigs. She likes the village bank because the loans help her a lot in life.

Her dream is to continue moving forward and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye habite au Sénégal. Il est père de famille et il évolue dans le secteur commercial depuis plus de 20 ans. Il est spécialisé dans l’achat et la vente de chaussures, de sacs  et d’autres articles divers pour femmes pour femmes.   Les revenus que lui procure  son activité lui permettent   d’assurer les charges familiales de son foyer, notamment la dépense quotidienne. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il avait obtenu auparavant 01 crédit antérieur. De nouveau, il sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 500.000 francs CFA dans le but d’acheter les articles  qu’il commercialise pour les revendre. Son objectif est d’augmenter le stock qu’il détient afin de satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle. Elle souhaite accroitre ses ressources financières de  sorte qu’il pourra se lancer dans la vente d’article de librairie (cahiers, livres, stylos…). L’amélioration de ses revenus pourra l’aider à mieux prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne et rendre meilleur   les conditions alimentaires  de sa famille. Son projet futur est d’ouvrir un magasin pour y exposer ses produits.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye lives in Senegal.  He has a family and has been involved in retail for more than 20 years.  He specializes in the commerce of shoes, handbags and other various items for women. Thanks to his income, he is able to provide for his family and he particularly takes care of the day-to-day expenses.

Abdoulaye is a client of one of the branches of the UIMCEC, and he has already obtained a previous loan.  He is now requesting a loan of 500,000 CFA francs to purchase some goods that he will resell.  His goal is to boost his stock of merchandise in order to meet his customers' increasing demand.  He also wants to strengten his financial resources and start selling stationery items (notebooks, books, pens ...).

A larger income will help Abdoulaye to take better care of his family's daily expenses and to improve their diet.  In the future, he would like to open a shop and display his products.

loans.use: to buy shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Alé

texts.fr: Monsieur Alé est un habitant du Sénégal. Il est père de famille et évolue dans le secteur du transport depuis 19 ans.  Son activité lui procure des revenus  qui lui donnent  les moyens de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Il est membre de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il a honoré son engagement vis a sis de son premier prêt obtenu. Il sollicite un second crédit de 250.000 francs CFA prévu   pour remplacer les organes défectueux de son véhicule. L’entretien de son véhicule lui permettra assurément de faire face durablement aux charges du foyer  et de rendre meilleurs les conditions de vie et le bien-être familial. Dans le futur, il aimerait bien devenir un grand transporteur.
texts.en:
Alé lives in Senegal.  He has a family and has worked in transportation for 19 years.  Thanks to his professional activity, he makes an income which allows him to meet the needs of his family.

Alé is a client of one of the branches of the UIMCEC and he has already honored a commitment and duly repaid his first loan.  He is now requesting a loan of 250,000 CFA francs, which will be used to replace some defective parts in his car.  

The maintenance of his car will certainly help him to meet his family's needs for a long period of time, and to improve their living conditions and well-being.  In the future,  Alé would like to become a major transporter.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rokhaya vit au Sénégal. Elle est divorcée et exerce une activité commerciale à travers  laquelle elle arrive à  participer a la gestion de  la dépense quotidienne. Cela fait plus de 10 ans qu’elle s’adonne a la  vente de produits locaux tels que :huile de palme, poissons  séchés et fumés…etc. Elle démarre sa journée  de travail a 08 heures du matin pour la terminer a 18 heures. Elle adhère à l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  où elle a déjà obtenu un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt d’un montant de 150.000 francs CFA  prévu pour s’approvisionner en produits locaux a revendre pour les besoins de son commerce. Ce prêt  lui donnera l’opportunité de  satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle et  d’augmenter les bénéfices qu’elle réalise a travers son activité. Par conséquent elle pourra alors avoir la possibilité d’élargir son activité, de diversifier  les produits qu’elle commercialise( démarrage de la vente de  pommes de terre et d’oignons), d’augmenter le nombre  de ses employés, de supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et enfin améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Dans le futur, elle aimerait bien acquérir  une maison pour ses enfants et avoir la possibilité  de les envoyer  à l’étranger  pour leurs études.
texts.en:
Rokhaya lives in Senegal.  She is divorced and is involved in a commercial activity which allows her to take part in the management of the day-to-day expenses.  For over ten years now, she has been selling local products such as palm oil, dried and smoked fish etc.  She works from 8AM until 6PM.  

Rokhaya is a client of one of the branches of the UIMCEC and she has already taken a loan from this institution.  She is requesting a new loan of 150,000 CFA francs which will be used to buy local products for resale, as part of her commercial activity.

Thanks to this loan, Rokhaya will be able to meet her customers' increasing demand, and her activity will become more profitable.  Consequently, this loan will also help her to expand her business, to diversify the products that she sells (she would like to start selling potatoes and onions), to increase the number of her employees, to cover her children's school fees and improve her family's diet.

In the future, she would like to buy a house for her children.  She would also like to be able to send them abroad for their studies.

loans.use: to buy local goods for resale (palm oil, fish..)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a transmission for his SM8 truck

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata habite au Sénégal.  Elle  est mariée et exerce une activité commerciale de  vente de vaisselle et de produits aloès Véra depuis 2006. Elle déjà obtenu 01 crédit au niveau de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle est sociétaire. De nouveau, elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 350.000 francs CFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter des produits aloès Véra a revendre. Le renforcement de son fond de roulement lui permettra d’élargir son activité et d’accroitre les ressources financières que lui procure son activité. Ainsi elle pourra continuer a  supporter ses charges familiales (scolarité des enfants et salaire domestique)  et aussi  d’épargner davantage  d’argent. Elle aspire à devenir une grande  commerçante dans la vente de produits Aloès Véra au sein de son pays.
texts.en:
Aminata lives in Senegal.  She is married and has been selling kitchen dishes and aloe vera products since 2006.  

She has already obtained a previous loan from one of the branches of the UIMCEC where she is a client.  Once again, she is requesting a loan of 350,000 CFA francs, which she is planning to use to buy aloe vera products for resale.  

By strengthening her working capital, she will be able to expand her activity and to increase the financial resources which she generates through her business.  In this manner, she will be able to continue to cover her part of the family expenses (children's school fees and domestic help's salary) and to save more money.  

Aminata's ambition is to become an important seller of aloe vera products within her country.

loans.use: to buy aloe vera products for resale.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Monsieur Omar est un habitant du Sénégal.Il gère une boutique qui est très fréquentée dans la localité ou il vit. Il est père de famille, et il gère les charges de sa famille grâce aux revenus que lui procure  de vente de produits alimentaires. Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 2000 et   commence sa journée de travail a 7 heures le matin jusqu'à 00 heures le soir. Il est membre de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il a déjà  bénéficié d’un crédit antérieur. Une fois de plus, il sollicite un prêt de 500.000 francs prévu  s’approvisionner en produits alimentaires divers qu’il va revendre. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices découlant de ce financement lui permettra de débuter la vente de produits cosmétiques que sa clientèle lui réclame et de pouvoir faire plus d’économies. Il  souhaite devenir une grande commerçante dans le domaine import-export.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumar lives in Senegal. He runs a busy shop in the place where he lives. He is the father of a family, and covers his family's expenses with the income earned from selling food products.

He's been a seller since 2000. He opens at 7 in the morning and closes at midnight. He's a member of one of U-IMCEC's branches, and already benefited from one loan.

He's seeking once again a loan of XOF 500'000, which he intends to use to buy various food products to resell. The profits increase expected from this loan will enable him to start selling cosmetics, which his clientele is requesting, and to save more money.

He wishes to become a large merchant in import-export.

loans.use: to buy food products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing and resale.

loans.name: Ruben Neptali

texts.es:
El señor Rubén tiene 28 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el vive  su hija y su esposa. Su trabajo permanente es agente de ventas,  trabajo que realiza desde hace 5 años en su comunidad donde vive.
Don Rubén el crédito lo necesita para la compra de cemento, laminas, lijas, madera, varilla, llavines etc. el impacto esperado con el crédito, es terminar las mejoras que le está haciendo a su casa de habitación y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia .
Don Rubén los planes a futuro es termina con las mejoras de su casa de habitación y así darles un mejor porvenir a cada uno de sus familiares, al mismo tiempo, tendrán una espacio más adecuado para el crecimiento de sus hijos. 




Choluteca, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Ruben, 28, lives in the south of Honduras with his wife and daughter. He has worked as a sales agent for 5 years in the community where he lives.

Ruben needs a loan to buy cement, metal sheeting, sandpaper, wood, rebar, locks, etc. The expected result of the loan is to finish making improvements to the house where he lives, and thus give his family better living conditions.

Ruben's future plans include finishing the home improvements and giving his relatives a better future; at the same time he will have a better space for his kids to grow in. 

Choluteca, Honduras - February 2013

loans.use: to buy cement, sheets of metal, sandpaper, wood, rebar, locks, etc for his house.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Evangelina una persona emprendedora  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos   en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  semilla de marañón.
Doña Evangelina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  semilla  de marañón.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar un poco su situación.
Doña  Evangelina  espera que  a un corto plazo   su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la región sur y seguir  apoyando a su familia para que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas personas de bien.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero  del   2013
texts.en:
Evangelina, an honest and serious entrepreneur, lives with her husband and 4 kids in the south of Honduras. She buys and sells cashews.

Evangelina needs the loan to purchase cashews. With the loan she hopes that her sales will increase because she will have more merchandise to offer her customers and also to cover their own needs, which will improve their situation a little.

Evangelina hopes that in the short term her business keeps growing and consolidating so that it becomes one of the largest and most recognized in the southern region, and that she can continue supporting her family so that her children become professionals. 



Choluteca, Honduras –  February  2013

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds.

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mor est un grand commerçant de friperie qui a 24 ans d’expérience. Il a démarré avec ses propres moyens avec un capital très minime avec lequel il a acheté une balle de chemises.
Mor, âgé de 42 ans est marié et père de deux enfants de 5 et 1an et demi. Il est à son 3ème crédit à l’MCEC et veut augmenter son stock de marchandises. Il démarre sa journée à 8h pour finir à 18h de l’après-midi. S’il sent que son capital augmente, il rêve de diversifier son activité et d’investir dans l’élevage en ouvrant une ferme.
texts.en:
Mr. Mor is a great second-hand clothing merchant with 24 years' experience. He started on his own with minimum capital with which he bought a bale of shirts.

Mor is 42 years old and is married with two children aged five and one and a half years. 

He is on his third credit loan with MCEC and wants to increase his stock of goods. He starts his day at 8 am and ends at 6 pm in the afternoon. 

Once he feels that his capital is increasing, he dreams of diversifying his business and wants to invest in breeding by starting up a farm.

loans.use: buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Tacko

texts.fr:
Madame Tacko une dame de 46 ans, est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle gère une gargote dans le quartier et fait aussi du commerce de prêt à porter. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Elle commence sa journée à 20h et termine à 00h. Tacko vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit à l’IMCEC pour améliorer son petit commerce. Avec les bénéfices tirés de l’activité, elle appuie son époux dans les charges de la maison.
Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tacko, age 46, is married and the mother of four children. She runs a small eatery in her neighborhood, and also sells ready-to-wear clothing.

She has more than ten years of experience in this field. She's open for 8 pm to midnight. 

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, IMCEC, in order to bolster her business. With the profits she earns from her business, she helps her husband cover the family expenses.

She ambitions to open a ready-to-wear shop.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing to resell, and improve her small eatery

loans.name: Nangué Fouta Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Nangué Fouta regroupe 4 femmes  qui évoluent dans le commerce. La responsable du groupe, nommée Aminata, est âgée de 50 ans, divorcée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’ainé a 22 ans et le cadet 10. Madame Aminata fait du commerce de draps de lit et a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Elle s’occupe de ses charges personnelles car ses enfants sont pris en compte par leur père. Elle rêve d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de draps, si elle voit son chiffre d’affaires augmenter.
texts.en:
Nangué Fouta is a loan group made of four women who are merchants. The group leader, named Aminata, is 50 years old, divorced, and the mother of seven children. The eldest is 22 years old, the youngest is 10.

Mrs. Aminata sells bed sheets. She has more than ten years of experience in this field. She provides for herself only, since her children are being taken care of by their father.

She dreams to open a shop to sell bed sheets, if her revenue increases.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to resell

loans.name: Edison Washington

texts.es:
Edison tiene 44 años de edad su estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa tiene 5 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos

La VRC  Solidaria, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Gabriel, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Edison  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz, potos. Además se dedica a la crianza de los animales como son los cerdos y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida.

Con la ayuda del credito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es comprarse un carro. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta son las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Edison is 44 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage with his wife. He has five children. He lives in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "Solidaria" is located in the rural settlement of San Gabriel. It belongs to the Ventanas Canton and is dedicated to agricultural and livestock workers.

Edison makes a living from agriculture. He sows maize, rice, and calabashes. He also breeds animals, such as pigs and chickens. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase urea, pesticide, and insecticide.

With the help of the loan he will be able to buy everything he needs for his agricultural activities. He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to buy a car. The challenges he faces are diseases. In his free time he likes to rest.

loans.use: to purchase urea, pesticide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Gerifati

texts.en:
Jerafati is a married man, aged 39 years, who has five children. He lives at Lutoma village. Of his five children, he has four who are attending schools. 

He is a farmer, who produces bananas, beans and maize, but the plantain fruit is 90% of his agriculture business. Jerafati works six days per week, having started his agriculture business in 2000. Since then, banana/plantain cultivation has been the main source of income for his family. The reason why he started plantain growing was to have a better home, and enough tuition money to educate his children.

Jerafati is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for his banana plants. After fertilizing in spring, in June and July he can harvest more plantains for higher income, because the quality will be good after applying fertilizers. He usually sells his bananas to city traders, who usually come after two weeks, and the surplus he sells to customers from neighboring areas, especially to people who have restaurants.

He hopes to be the leading supplier of bananas in his village. However, he still has the problems of weather changes and price fluctuations. He describes himself as a hard-working man, and above all, an honest man. Above, Jerafati is pictured in his banana plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his banana plants

loans.name: Dado Pithiel

texts.fr:
Madame Dado Pithiel une dame de 58 ans, est veuve et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de 7 ans. Elle travaille de 9h à 14h. Elle est à sa première expérience de crédit et a recouru vers IMCEC, afin de pouvoir augmenter l’offre. Elle s’occupe des charges familiales puisse que son époux est décédé.
Avec les bénéfices de l’activité, elle réussi à se gérer et à réinvestir dans son petit commerce.
Elle rêve d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale pour diversifier son activité.
texts.en: Mrs Dado Pithiel is a 58 year-old widow with children. She has sold vegetables for a living for seven years. She works between 9am and 2pm. This is the first loan she has requested and so she sought out IMCEC in order to improve her vegetable offer. She sees to her family's needs, as her husband is deceased. With the profits she generates from the business she looks after herself and her family and invests back into the business. She dreams of one day opening a general food store in order to diversify her business activities.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for re-sale at the market

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en: Ms. Asia is a dedicated and hard-working women. She is committed to work to improve the life style of her family. She has applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 so that she can buy ready-made clothes and start a self-sustained income-generating business. She wants to purchase clothing that she can sell at profitable prices. She is very keen to work on this, as it will definitely help her to have a better life. Her husband is a tailor, and she has five daughters. The loan would provide an effective alternative source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy ready-made clothing and start a business.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maimouna, une dame de 40 ans, est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait de l’embouche depuis 3 ans maintenant. Elle vient pour la deuxième fois pour solliciter un crédit de 300000F CFA pour compléter et acheter 2 bœufs, les élever et les revendre dans le voisinage. Elle s’occupe de ses charges personnelles et appuie son mari dans les autres charges de la maison.
Avec le crédit, elle pourra augmenter le nombre de tête à élever. Elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale pour diversifier et maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Ms. Maimouna, a 40-year-old woman, is married and the mother of six children. She has been fattening livestock for three years now. She is here for a second time to request a loan of 300,000 francs CFA to round out her funds and purchase 2 head of cattle to raise and sell in the neighborhood. She takes care of her personal expenses and supports her husband in covering household expenses. 

With this loan, she will be able to increase the number of livestock to raise. She would like to open a grocery store to diversify and to maximize her profits.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard was born in 1971 at Rwakabengo southern division Rukungiri – District. He is married to Charity, a teacher by profession, and blessed with two children. He started a project of brick laying, which was his major source of income for a long period of time, but in 2012 a friend of his introduced him to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), which he joined with the intention of acquiring a loan to expand his project.

Based on the client's previous loan, he was able to expand his project and started another project, which is piggery, and now he is concentrating on piggery and he took this loan to buy more pigs to expand the project.

He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the support it has given him to continue running the project from which he has been able to enhance his income and also to send his children to school.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Fatou Kiné

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  Kine  vit au Sénégal.  Elle est mariée et évolue dans le secteur du  commerce  depuis 02 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de produits divers tels que  tissus, encens…etc. Elle commence sa journée de travail  à 9 heures pour la terminer à 17 heures.  C’est  avec  l’aide des revenus que lui procure son activité qu’elle parvient  à contribuer à la gestion de la satisfaction des besoins familiaux. Elle est sociétaire de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC ou  elle sollicite un prêt de 300.000 francs CFA. Ce financement va lui servir à s’alimenter en  tissus et  encens  dans l’objectif de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Par conséquent l’augmentation de son fond de roulement pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses profits et de mieux participer aux dépenses quotidiennes au sein de  son ménage et améliorer le niveau de ses économies.  Son projet futur consiste à solidifier davantage son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou Kine lives in Senegal. She is married and has been working in the commerce sector for two years. She is specialized in selling a variety of goods, such as cloth, incense,… etc. She begins her workday at 9 AM and finishes at 5 PM.  With the help of the income from her business, she is able to participate in managing and satisfying family needs. 

She is an associate of a U-IMCEC branch, where she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs CFA. This financing will serve to supply her with some fabrics and incenses with the goal of satisfying the demands of her customers.  Consequently, increasing her working capital will be enable her to increase her profits and do better in helping to meet the day-to-day expenses of her household, as well as to improve her level of savings. Her future plans include solidifying her business further.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and incense to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Aichata

texts.fr: Madame  Aichata  est une femme mariée qui demeure dans l’une  des  banlieues Sénégalaises. Elle  évolue dans le secteur du commerce plus précisément  dans la vente de tissus depuis  3 ans.  Les revenus qu’elle obtient a travers son activité lui permettent de  participer dans les charges de dépenses quotidiennes de son foyer. Elle est sociétaire du guichet de sa zone d’habitation  et sollicite un crédit de 200 000 prévus pour le renforcement de son fond de roulement afin de s’approvisionner en tissus et renforcer son stock. Elle ambitionne d’agrandir son business dans le futur.
texts.en:
Aichata is a married woman who lives in a Senegalese suburb. She has been selling fabrics for three years. The earnings from this business allow her to help with her family's everyday household expenses. 

She is a member of a her local branch and is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs XOF so that she can increase her working capital in order to procure fabrics and increase her stock. 

She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Oulimata  habite au Sénégal. C’est une jeune  femme qui arrive à subvenir à ses besoins personnels  grâce à son activité de couturière qu’elle exerce depuis presque 02 ans. Sa préoccupation consiste  à acheter des tissus qu’elle confectionne et expose  à la vente. Elle est  membre au niveau de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA. Elle a l’intention d’utiliser ce prêt pour acheter les tissus qui lui permettront d’augmenter  les propositions de prêts  a porter  qu’elle offre à sa clientèle. Par conséquent, l’amélioration de ses gains lui permettra de  continuer de participer dans la gestion des charges familiales mais aussi   d’épargner  de l’argent. Son projet dans le futur s’inscrit dans le cadre de son désir de développer  davantage son  activité.
texts.en:
Miss Oulimata lives in Senegal. For the past two years this young woman managed to meet her personal needs through her activity as a seamstress. Her concern is about buying fabric with which she makes clothes for sale.

She is a member at one of the the U-IMCEC branches where she is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs. She plans to use this loan to buy fabric which will increase the choice of ready-to-wear clothing she can offer her customers.

Therefore improving earnings allows her to continue to participate in managing family responsibilities but also to save money. Projects for the future stem from her wish to expand her business activities.

loans.use: Buy fabric to make clothing and to resell

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rokhaya  vit au Sénégal. C’est une femme mariée  qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce duis presque 02 ans. Son activité  concerne  la vente de tissus, ce qui lui donne l’opportunité de participer dans la gestion de  la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille. Elle est  sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt de 100.00 francs CFA. L’objet du prêt est de s’approvisionner en tissus qu’elle  a l’intention d’écouler sur le marché. Son objectif est de développer son activité  afin de parvenir a supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants et  ensuite, dans la mesure du possible épargner de l’argent. Elle envisage d’élargir  son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokhaya lives in Senegal. This is a married woman who has been engaged in retail trading for almost two years. Her activity is the sale of fabric, which gives her the opportunity to participate in managing her family's needs.

She is an associate at one of the U-IMCEC branches where she is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs. The purpose of the loan is to buy fabric she intends to resell at market.

Her goal is to develop her activity so she can support her children's schooling costs and also to save as much money as possible. She plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy fabric for resale

loans.name: Awa Thioye

texts.fr: Madame Awa Thioye est une femme mariée qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans le secteur  du  commerce  depuis pratiquement 02 ans. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de tissus divers. Elle est sociétaire de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA. Avec  ce financement  elle envisage d’acheter des tissus qu’elle va  revendre   à sa clientèle. Ainsi, avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices elle pourra continuer à participer dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de son foyer et accroitre son épargne. Son projet futur est de développer davantage son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa Thioye is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been active in the commercial sector for almost two years and specializes in selling various fabrics.

She is a member at one of the U-IMCEC branches where she is requesting a loan for 100,000 CFA francs. With this funding she plans to buy fabrics she will then resell to her customers.

Thus, increasing profits will enable her to continue to participate in managing daily household expenses and increase her savings. Her future project is to further develop her business activity.

loans.use: buy fabric for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy ready-to-wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Aissata Nilal

texts.fr: Madame Aissata Nilal est âgée de 74 ans et s’active toujours dans le commerce dans lequel elle est entrée par amour. Elle a démarré dès le jeune âge dans ce métier. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 40 ans maintenant. Et a démarré avec une petite somme qu’elle a tiré de son épargne. Elle vient solliciter pour la 1ère fois un crédit de 100000F CFA pour améliorer son commerce. Avec le crédit, elle pourra acheter des céréales comme du mil, du mais, des arachides qu’elle va revendre devant chez elle, car vu son âge avancé, elle ne peut plus faire des déplacements éloignés. C’est pour s’occuper qu’elle continue à pratiquer cette activité. Avec l’argent qu’elle gagne elle règle ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissata Nilal is 74 years old and still active in the retail market sector which she chose as a labor of love. She started at a young age in this business, and has accumulated over 40 years' experience now.

She started with a small sum she withdrew from her savings. For the first time she is requesting a credit loan for 100,000 FCFA to improve her business.

With the loan she will buy cereals such as millet, corn, and peanuts she resells from her house-front: given her advanced age, she can no longer travel distances.

She continues this activity to keep herself busy. With the money she earns she takes care of her personal needs.

loans.use: buy grain cereal to resell

loans.name: Harouna Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Harouna Abdoulaye est un jeune boutiquier de 44 ans qui exerce le métier depuis 3 ans. Il a démarré son activité grâce à l’amour qu’il vouait au commerce avec de maigres revenus, argent qu’il avait économisé petit à petit. Il possède une boutique dans lequel il vend des denrées alimentaires comme du lait, des bouillons, du savon, de la tomate, de la boisson et d’autres produits divers. Il commence sa journée à 6h et ferme à 22h du soir.
Il est marié et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Il envisage d’ouvrir un grand magasin d’alimentation si son capital augmente.
texts.en: Harouna Abdoulaye is a young, 44-year-old shopkeeper who has been in this line of work for 3 years. He started his business because of his affinity with retail, using the meagre revenues he had earned and saved up bit by bit. He owns a shop in which he sells food items like milk, stock, tomatoes and drink and various other products like soap. His workday starts at 6 o'clock and he closes up at 10 o'clock at night. He is married and does not yet have children. He takes care of his family's daily expenditures. He plans to open a large food shop if his capital increases.

loans.use: to buy food items such as milk, stock, and tomatoes and soap for resale.

loans.name: Oumar Hamady

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar Hamady un homme de 51 ans est un grand éleveur qui exerce le métier depuis 3 ans. Il est marié et père de 11 enfants dont l’ainé a 18 ans et le cadet, un bébé de 1 mois.
Son activité consiste à acheter du bétail, à l’engraisser pendant 8 à 9mois, et à le revendre après. Avec le crédit, il peut désormais augmenter le nombre de bêtes dans son enclos.
Monsieur Oumar Hamady gère sa dépense quotidienne et veille à l’éducation de ses enfants. Il désirerait ouvrir un jour, un verger pour y faire des cultures maraichères.
texts.en: Oumar Hamady, a 51-year-old man, is a large livestock breeder who has been in this line of work for 3 years. He is married and the father of 11 children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old and the youngest, a 1-month-old baby. His business consists of buying oxen which he fattens during 8 or 9 months and then resells. With this loan, he will be able to increase the amount of livestock in his pen. Oumar Hamady manages his daily expenditures and makes sure that his children get an education. One day, he would like to start an orchard and engage in market gardening.

loans.use: to buy oxen for resale.

loans.name: Aissata Oumar

texts.fr:
Madame Aissata Oumar une dame de 36 ans, évolue dans la vente de prêt à porter  ou elle a acquis une expérience de 2 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a ouvert un compte à l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir accéder au crédit et  améliorer son commerce qui est à ses débuts. Elle gère ses propres charges et appuie de temps en temps dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne, ce qui n’est pas pour autant une obligation.
Elle rêve dans l’avenir, d’ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale si elle a un bon chiffre d’affaire et l’aide d’IMCEC financièrement.
texts.en: Aissata Oumar is a 36-year-old woman. She sells ready-to-wear clothing and has 2 years experience. She is married and the mother of 5 children. She has opened an account at UIMCEC in order to gain access to credit and improve her business, which is just beginning. She manages her own expenses and occasionally helps out with the daily expenditures, even though it is not an obligation. She dreams of one day opening a grocery shop, if she has a successful turnover and financial support from UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.fr: Madame Mayram, une dame de 43 ans, marié et mère de 5 enfants fait du transport depuis 10 ans. Elle vient pour la première fois demander un crédit de 350000F CFA pour l’achat d’un cheval avec lequel il va faire du transport de bagages. Elle s’occupe de ses charges personnelles. Pour diversifier ses activités elle veut investir dans la vente de prêt à porter et ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en: Mayram, a 43-year-old woman, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been providing transportation services for 10 years. She is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 350 000 francs with which to buy a horse to use for baggage transportation. She takes care of her personal expenses. In order to diversify her business, she would like to invest in the sales of ready-to-wear clothing and open a shop.

loans.use: to buy a horse to use for baggage transportation.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Il est âgé de 41 ans et s’active dans la vente de pain et cela depuis 5 ans déjà. Il s’appelle Adama, il est marié et père de 5 enfants âgé de 14 ans pour l’ainé et de juste 6 mois pour le cadet. Il vient pour la seconde fois solliciter un crédit de 300000F CFA pour améliorer son commerce. Il pourra acheter de la farine et des ingrédients pour la fabrication de pain. C’est à partir des bénéfices qu’il tire sa dépense quotidienne et s’occupe de son foyer. 
Dans l’avenir, il aimerait ouvrir une boulangerie moderne mais aussi vendre des habits prêts à porter.
texts.en: Adama is 41 years old and has been selling bread for 5 years. He is married and the father of 5 children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest, just 6 months. He is requesting a loan, for the second time, of 300 000 francs with which to improve his business. He will be able to buy flour and other ingredients with which to make bread. He covers his daily expenses and takes care of his household using his profits. In the future, he would like to open a modern bakery and also sell ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients with which to make bread for resale.

loans.name: Gpf Cheikh Tidiane Group

texts.fr: Le GPF Cheikh Tidiane regroupe 4 femmes qui ont des liens de parenté. Elles évoluent toute dans le commerce de produits divers. La responsable du groupe, la dame Oumou, s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires divers comme de la pate d’arachide, des haricots… depuis 20 ans. Oumou, âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’ainé a 27 ans et le plus jeune, 5 ans. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne. Avec une augmentation de revenus, elle veut bien construire sa maison et sécuriser sa famille.
texts.en:
The group GPF Cheikh Tidiane consists of four women who are related. They all sell miscellaneous merchandise. The leader of the group is Oumou, who has been selling various food products such as groundnut paste, beans, etc. for 20 years. 

Oumou, age 47, is a married mother to eight children aged 5 to 27. She helps with the daily expenses. 

With an increase in her income, she plans to build a house and provide for her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy various food products such as groundnut paste and beans for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various food products for resale.

loans.name: Ndomo

texts.fr:
Agée de 65 ans, madame Ndomo, s’active dans la vente de thiakry (qui est un aliment dérivé du mil et qui se consomme avec du lait caillé. Cela fait maintenant 3 ans qu’elle évolue dans ce domaine. Elle vient solliciter un crédit de cent mille francs afin de pouvoir acheter le mil, le transformer et acheter aussi les ingrédients qui vont avec ce met. 
Elle gère ses propres charges et appuie quand elle le  désire à la dépense quotidienne de la famille, car elle a une grande famille et ne peut pas rester les bras croisés. Elle est âgée mais s’active pour ne pas rester sédentaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndomo is 65 years old and has a business selling thiakry (food made from millet mixed with curdled milk). She has been working in this field for the past three years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to purchase millet to then make into thiakry and to purchase the other ingredients necessary.
She takes care of her own personal expenses and when she's able contributes to her family's expenses. Since she has a large family, she refuses to stay idle. She's aging, but doesn't want to be sedentary.

loans.use: to purchase millet to make thiakry and for resale

loans.name: José Rubén

texts.es:
José Rubén es un joven de 32 años que habita en la comarca San Agustín del municipio de El Sauce ubicado a 15 km de dicho municipio, padre de dos niños en edad escolar.

Se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad en una Institución donde tiene siete años de laborar. Para él que habita en el campo le ha tocado una vida dura, ya que proviene de una familia muy pobre que sus únicos ingresos han sido la cosecha de granos para subsistir, pero le da gracias por tener trabajo actualmente donde hoy tiene ingresos fijos para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Diario tiene que recorrer estos 15 km de ida y regreso en bicicleta para estar puntual en su centro de trabajo y lo desempeña de la mejor manera y con entusiasmo porque en Nicaragua hay mucho desempleo y muchas personas que desean tener un trabajo digno.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para Compra de medicamentos, pago de consultas y realización de exámenes, ya que su hija ha estado mal de salud y con lo poco que gana no puede cubrir estos gastos.

Pide el apoyo y ayuda a los inversionistas de Kiva para que le financien este crédito a través de Ceprodel y poder curar a su niña.
texts.en:
José Rubén is a 32-year old young man who lives in the region of San Agustín, located 15km away from the municipality of El Sauce. He has two children attending school. 

He has worked as a security guard in an institution for 7 years. He used to have a tough life living in the countryside as he comes from a very poor family where the only income came from grain harvests. However, he's now grateful for having a job and fixed income to take the bread home. He needs to cover 15km by bicycle to go and return from work everyday and works very well and with enthusiasm. Nicaragua has a high unemployment and many people wish to have a decent job. 

He's now requesting a loan to buy medicines and pay doctor bills and medical tests, as his daughter has been ill and he can't afford to cover those expenses. He's asking for the help and support of Kiva lenders so that they will finance this loan through Ceprodel and help him heal his daughter.

loans.use: to buy medicines and pay doctor bills and medical tests.

loans.name: Gpf Fedde Daribe Matam Group

texts.fr:
Le GPF Feede Daribe Matam regroupe 5 femmes qui ont des liens de parenté entre elles et qui font toute du commerce.
La responsable s’appelle Dieynaba, âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait de la vente de produits divers : habillement, chaussures, cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine et  travaille de 10h à 12h. Elle n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent sinon ses besoins personnels.
Dieynaba veut un jour, ouvrir une boutique de vente de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
The group GPF Feede Daribe Matam has five women members who are all relatives and who work in business.
The leader of the group, Dieynaba is 49 years old, married and has six children. She has a business of selling a variety of products: clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She has been in business for the past three years and works from 10am to 12 noon. She doesn't have the burden of a lot of expenses, just her own personal needs.
Dieynaba would like to one day open her own store selling ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for resale: cosmetics, shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine à travers de MAIMOUNA. Elle est la troisième femme de la gauche vers la droite Elle fait l’achat vente des  ustensiles de cuisine et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 douzaines de tasses en plastique  à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of 6 women who are all married and have an average age of 32 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional, extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the district of Massablacoura, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they could better do business. They are on their 8th loan and the previous loans have been correctly repaid.

This group of women sells kitchen utensils via Maimouna. She is the third from the left in the picture. She buys and sells kitchen utensils and plans to use her loan to buy 10 dozen plastic cups in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and at home, for cash or credit, to a clientèle mostly made up of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business and part of which will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DJIGUISSEME  est constitué de 3 femmes  mariées et 1 veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans et.  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les sept précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à travers KADIATOU qui est la femme assise papier en main.  Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales et compte acheter avec son  prêt 1200Kg de maïs avec les paysans. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is constituted of three married women and one widow averaging 52 years of age, with five children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and children in the Massablacoura district of the town of Bougouni.

They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. IN order to strengthen their financing capacity and better manage their business, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their eight loan. The seven preceding loans have been duly repaid. The group members sell cereals, which is what Kadiatou does, for example. She is the one holding a paper in her hands. She buys and resells cereals, and her plan is to user her loan to buy 1200 kg [2646 lbs] of cereals from farmers. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed mainly of women. She plans to achieve an average monthly revenue of 50,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business and used to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième  prêt. Les sept précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à travers de ROUTIE, elle est la première femme de la gauche vers la droite. Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1500Kg de mais avec les paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 4 women who are all married and have an average age of 43 and, on average, 5 children. They live in traditional, extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the district of Massablacoura, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other through neighbourly and professional relationships, and friendships. They joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity, so that they could better do business, and are on their 8th loan. The seven previous loans have been properly repaid.

This group of women sells cereals via Routie. She is on the far left in the picture. She buys and sells cereals and plans to use her loan to buy 1500 kgs of corn from the farmers. She makes her sales at the market and at home, for cash or credit, to a retail clientèle composed mainly of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which will be reinvested in her business and part of which will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   PIMA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de36 ans et. 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur neuvième prêt. Les huit précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à travers MARIAM, elle est la première femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de céréales  et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 tonnes de maïs avec les producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Pima Group is made up of six married women with an average age of 36 years and an average of six children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the Massablacoura district of the city of Bougouni. These women know one another through ties of vicinity, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity with the aim of improving their business, the group joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are currently on their ninth loan cycle. The eight previous loans have been repaid in full.

This group of women does business selling grain through Mariam, shown in the photo on the far right. Mariam buys and sells grain, and with this loan, she plans to purchase two tons of corn from growers. Mariam sells her grain at the market and from her home, at retail, for cash and on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women. Mariam expects to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grain.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA  est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de farine à travers BADJENE,elle  est la deuxième femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de farine et compte acheter avec son  prêt 300Kg  farine avec les commerçants de Bamako.
